subject: Sales
title: Social Proof in Action
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Social Proof in Action.

hook.text: Hotel signs saying 'most guests reuse towels' boosted reuse by 26%. Peer pressure works silently.

buildup.text: We look to others when uncertain. If the crowd chose it, our brain assumes it must be right.

discovery.text: Cialdini's hotel study proved specific social proof outperforms vague appeals every single time.

twist.text: Social proof backfires when misused. Saying 'most people cheat on taxes' actually increases cheating.

climax.text: Highlight what your best customers do, not what the worst ones avoid. Positive proof wins.

punchline.text: Show the crowd doing it right and others follow.

quiz.question: Why can social proof backfire?
options: Highlighting bad behavior can normalize it
